top_comments.comment: My guest room is the Holiday Inn a mile away. Five stars for everyone.

Solution for small guest room, where  no room for a welcome basket because guests use up all flat surfaces for their luggage, tote bags, purses, laptops, cell phones, chargers.  So instead of a gift basket, I hung up a new 24 pocket, over-the-door organizer, on hooks on the wall in back of the guest room door. The pockets are clear, so they can see everything easily...such as  individually wrapped chocolates, nuts, dried fruit, area maps, notepads+pens, hand sanitizer, small bottles of water /wine,  face masks, tissues, perfume,  disposable slippers, breath mints, cough drops, sleep masks.

The problem with creating a really lovely guest room will be way too many guests -- mean family and friends that ones husband misses or my family that actually moved in with us more than once. I used to host guests 4-6 months of the year, and did not have a life of my own. My husband is half Italian, so he loves people coming, but he went fishing so they could have fish or crab, and I was left with cooking, cleaning, beds, laundry and so forth. We became the holiday destination. When I asked my family, or friends to book a hotel my husband was mortified. I was tired!! 
It is ok for a few people now and then, and a few days at a time, that never bothered me. It was the two weeks in a row, and I had girls, garden, they had many dance classes and school. ..... Anyway.... be careful. 
It took a couple decades and creating a studio apartment when we built our house to slow guests down.. sort of. I finally ran a bed and breakfast I was already doing it for free for years. 

Anyway, be careful how nice and cozy you make it, try to have some things that will be not so comfortable so they know when to go home!
This is a great idea for entertaining my friends - my extended family not so much…they’d never go home 😂
First, you look fab 💖 Second, I love the offering of a firm pillow and a plush one - yes 🙌 Finally I too have a welcome basket ready 🤗✌️

comments_since_last_sample.body: Thanks for your wisdom!
Okay. Crisp, new white sheets, or pre-washed? Ironing is never on my to-do list.

Lisa I worked in luxury Hospitaly for a number of years . I just finished two guest room and viola .. I have comfort , white linens , plush white towels , white robes , water carafe next to bed and a little crystal jar of delicious gummy bears 🥰glad your advice is much like my own personal taste . Thank you

I hit all the points for my last guest, but the robe.  Then was treated like a hotelier for their stay.  🙄Lucky for me they checked out early! 🤣 These are great tips and spot on.  Get ready for those holiday guests in style.
Can you recommend some high quality sheets and towels?
Hahaha they will then turn into welcomed guest after giving them this VIP treatment.

I have a wall shelf in mine I have different types of things in it phone charges little mirror , mask to sleep, ect : I’ve always had fun setting up
My guest room

The problem with creating a really lovely guest room will be way too many guests -- mean family and friends that ones husband misses or my family that actually moved in with us more than once. I used to host guests 4-6 months of the year, and did not have a life of my own. My husband is half Italian, so he loves people coming, but he went fishing so they could have fish or crab, and I was left with cooking, cleaning, beds, laundry and so forth. We became the holiday destination. When I asked my family, or friends to book a hotel my husband was mortified. I was tired!! 
It is ok for a few people now and then, and a few days at a time, that never bothered me. It was the two weeks in a row, and I had girls, garden, they had many dance classes and school. ..... Anyway.... be careful. 
It took a couple decades and creating a studio apartment when we built our house to slow guests down.. sort of. I finally ran a bed and breakfast I was already doing it for free for years. 

Anyway, be careful how nice and cozy you make it, try to have some things that will be not so comfortable so they know when to go home!

Solution for small guest room, where  no room for a welcome basket because guests use up all flat surfaces for their luggage, tote bags, purses, laptops, cell phones, chargers.  So instead of a gift basket, I hung up a new 24 pocket, over-the-door organizer, on hooks on the wall in back of the guest room door. The pockets are clear, so they can see everything easily...such as  individually wrapped chocolates, nuts, dried fruit, area maps, notepads+pens, hand sanitizer, small bottles of water /wine,  face masks, tissues, perfume,  disposable slippers, breath mints, cough drops, sleep masks.
This is a great idea for entertaining my friends - my extended family not so much…they’d never go home 😂

I would add a charging station- or at least easy access to wall socket. No one wants to disturb their host to ask where a socket is or go crawling around the room. Lots of lamps have USB charging, so really make sure you have an Android and an Apple cable on hand.
Surface space and accessible outlets are important.  Better yet, have a charging area.  An index card with the Wi-Fi password.  I also put a nightlight in the guest bathroom
Well now.....I do all the things for my guests other than the bathrobes.....and I do Airbnb and VRBO for my Casita.  You are correct-a-mondo!  Amen Sista!
I like to give my guests the ultimate treat - the local b&b!  😂

Great tips! Adding more hooks! Love that idea! I also have bottled water, an espresso coffee maker with coffee pods and tea bags, and a micro mini fridge with sparking water in the closet shelving until (with all the cups, glasses and set ups) along with some snacks. Essential oils and mister, universal mobile phone charging station and relaxation scented candles. 

Had to laugh, you said, "even if it's your kids sister."  Um, that would be your daughter.  HAHA
My guest room is the Holiday Inn a mile away. Five stars for everyone.
First, you look fab 💖 Second, I love the offering of a firm pillow and a plush one - yes 🙌 Finally I too have a welcome basket ready 🤗✌️
One time, while staying with relatives,  they put me and the other grannies in a room with multiple terrariums full of tarantulas and big spiders!
I also have a folding suitcase stand that I store in the guest bedroom closet

Am I the only one who finds the concept of a guest bathrobe disturbing? I mean, if it’s your own bathrobe (or housecoat, as we call it in Canada), then that’s fine, but somebody else’s robe cradling your intimates? Gross! 😂 Otherwise, great tips! 

People don’t generally stay with me because I don’t drive, and also this is the first time I’ve had a guest bedroom (it normally functions as a media room but it’s simple to change it over). I hope I can host someone sometime!
